channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WV

item.title: Report E-2024100668
item.description:
Report E-2024100668

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-29
  • City: HURRICANE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at rest area for a load check and noticed liquid dripping from trailer. Driver called the emergency respace number and crews were dispatched to the scene for clean up. Driver was informed to call 911 due to not being able to contain the dripping from running off and there were rain showers present in the area. The fire department showed up on scene and were able to place absorbent down to prevent any runoff. The response crew showed up on scene at 2045et. The crew unloaded the drums to gain access to the leaking container. 2200 the container was accessed and was placed into the Salvage Drum and all absorbents were added to the drum that were used during the clean up. 2245et the trailer was reloaded and secured for transport and job was completed.

item.title: Report E-2024090548
item.description:
Report E-2024090548

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: MORGANTOWN
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COWAN TRANSPORT SERVICES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On September 18, 2024, Cowan Intermodal Group, LLC contacted Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a release in Morgantown, WV. It was reported an undetermined amount of BelcleneÂ® 200 was due to a single vehicle accident was caused by the truck striking a guardrail and flipping onto its side, the release impacted soil, asphalt and a nearby storm drain. It was also reported the impacted area was 60ft by 30ft and approximately 5000 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors contacted DOT to provide traffic control to excavate the damaged travel lines. Excavation was complete asphalt milling and a surface scrape that measured 85ft by 8ft area. 2 roll offs containing impacted soil and 3 roll off boxes of asphalt milling were collected. There were 16 totes total involved. The product was vacuumed out of the bottom of the trailer into 1 vac truck and 9 different totes for transfer. The 16 damaged totes were placed in 2 roll off boxes and staged at a near by DOT site. All waste generated was taken off-site for proper disposal.
